Exercise 5.36 (a)
WOLG let $X_{1}$ be the min $(X_{1}, X_{2},X_{3})\\$
$P(T\leq l)= P(x_{1} \leq l)=1-P(x_{1} \geq l)\\$
$=1-{P(x_{i}\geq l)}^{3}\\$
$=1-e^{-l/2}\\$
\newpage
Exercise 5.36 (b)
WOLG let $X_{1}$ be the max of $(x_{1}, x_{2}, X_{3})\\$
$P(T \leq l) = P(x_{1} \leq l)\\$
$=(1-e^{-l/6})^{3})\\$
